soar.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to increase quickly to a high level
soar.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
soar.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to fly, especially very high up in the sky, floating on air currents
soar.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She watched the dove soar above the chestnut trees.
soar.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to go quickly upwards to a great height
soar.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The ball soared to left field.
soar.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if your spirits (=the way you are feeling, for example happy, sad etc)  or hopes soar, you begin to feel very happy or hopeful
soar.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Adamâ€™s smile sent her spirits soaring.
soar.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if buildings, trees, towers etc soar, they look very tall and impressive
soar.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Here the cliffs soar a hundred feet above the sea.
soar.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to increase quickly to a high level
soar.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Beef demand soared due to Americans adopting high protein diets.
